tweets.text: @agricontract @maritime_fox @EnvAgency The container is not full. Surface flow and water flashing off the landscape causes a large volume of water to come off the land into your very straight channel very quickly. That big pulse of water is what causes the flood.
@maritime_fox @EnvAgency How can you hold water in a full container?

domain.name: TV Shows

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

tweets.text: It‚Äôs been v.exciting üëç to deliver this #NFM project on Stock Beck with @cumbriawildlife We‚Äôre just finishing 7 flood storage bunds. Let's just check that statement shall we. https://t.co/tAAPJW9Wge

tweets.text: Our @EnvAgencyNW Pump Team met with @johncurtinEA this morning at Didsbury Flood Storage Reservoir. We‚Äôve been pumping 24/7 reducing levels from 95% to <20% in less than a week. This will make sure we are ready for the next storm - hopefully not anytime soon!#TeamEA #PumpAction https://t.co/Lee4eSad2C

@KirstyBreaks @ilkleyIain @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @SandTCUKYorks You're not channelling your inner Shinto. It's the Hetton torii to the home of the sacred kami, Flasby https://t.co/68KqKfRm0O
This map shows the scale of the issue of agricultural pollution in Wales and why we are taking action. üëá https://t.co/8xPJR2UG8z

#Aire trib with @YorksWildlife assessing diffuse pollution & habitat potential. Mix of good, bad & ugly. Much evidence of excessive bank erosion by wooldebeest. Bald meander return of channel to rightful place!
Upper Aire Project @EnvAgencyYNE @WildTroutTrust @YorksFarmWild https://t.co/p2ZY2H5oNI
@ilkleyIain @ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @SandTCUKYorks What‚Äôs it called? - needs a title and an eloquent description.....

Water Environment Field Worker @EnvAgency in #Penrith

See: https://t.co/jUMl3kOm4Z

#CumbriaJobs #PenrithJobs @EnvAgencyJobs https://t.co/i6AZRwxhtt

@GavinTabinerEA @johncurtinEA @EnvAgency @OliverHarmarEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyYNE After looking after us for the past week and keeping us flood free this is really fabulous support from the team. A big thank you once again from all the residents of Ryther village.

New Vacancy üëâ Engagement Officer: Green Recovery for Morecambe Bay's Woodlands Project üíö

Apply today: https://t.co/TF41ZIj7Nx

The Green Recovery Challenge Fund is a @DefraGovUK/@HeritageFundUK initiative in partnership with @NaturalEngland and the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/iOo3bvU6Ql

The old #Foss Barrier gate has been lifted out by crane today as we prepare for the new gate to be lifted into place tomorrow. This is part of our ¬£38m upgrade that will reduce #flood risk to 1,200 properties in #York https://t.co/M1nbHt3mIi

Pleased I got a quick response from @Brent_Council after querying what actions they will look to take to resolve the situation at the #WelshHarp.

Discussions are ongoing between @CRTSouthEast/ @EnvAgency. To resolve this, all stakeholders must work together. @welshharpies https://t.co/pi2lizYtpD

We‚Äôre continuing to carry out recovery operations following on from responding to #stormchristoph over the past week. The Ouse & Wharfe field team have been out in #Ryther this afternoon with our sweeper to clear up mud from an access road in order to ensure it is safe for use. https://t.co/QN5iBxK0vf

@ilkleyIain @ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @SandTCUKYorks ‚ÄúMoses Gate‚Äù
When the time comes for Noah to venture forth may Moses Gate still those troubled waters.

@KirstyBreaks @ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @SandTCUKYorks Pointless Gate

An attempt, of sorts, to protect the watercourse from invaders?!?

Sign up for flood alerts here: https://t.co/KuIjpLKutU https://t.co/YKXL8pGzxf

More heavy rain coming in next 24 hours. Remember: even when the weather calms, rivers continue to rise, so please check #FloodWarnings all week here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY It's a free service, updated every 15 mins. It could save your life. #PrepareActSurvive @EnvAgency https://t.co/swa11ANaVu

tweets.text: @agricontract @EnvAgency Even at peak dredging back in its heyday the weaver flooded. The logic is the wrong way round. You need to delay the water and hold it in the catchment area, not speed it up. Remember most of this water is coming from the pennines via the Dane.

If the the @EnvAgency CEO @JamesBevanEA is not aware that sewage is discharged into chalk streams what chance have we got. The @RiverChess has had 79 sewage discharges over a 16 month period between 24 Sept 2019 and 25th Jan 2021.

@SayNo2SizewellC @nocotu @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk EDF can't finalise key details or afford to build it, their owners wont rescue them, no  record of delivery of an EPR, have no regard to nature (Coronation wood) & have sent brochures to locals which were full of spin & inaccuracy & then submitted  their plans during lockdown.

tweets.text:
Don't get me wrong.

Thank you @ab4scambs for doing all this to save our #chalkstreamsincrisis, thank you üôè

But regulation needs to be enforced. Licenses need to be revoked. @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency have teeth. They need to start using them.

6/6

Im sick of flooding can the @EnvAgency please look at what the Dutch to control rain fall remember you used to be called the National rivers authority üò°
#ollyblogs #LockdownLearning  #OllyRants #flooding #farming https://t.co/109bZBoZ6S

The cosy relationship between the leadership of regulators and the boards of the industries that they regulate means nothing changes.

Do water companies offer cosy directorships to @EnvAgency directors as a bribe to stop them from doing their jobs? 

4/6 https://t.co/tUOvqnYCYD

Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv

tweets.text:
Astonished to learn that on 14 Jan @EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA told the Public Accounts Committee that "we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Did he intentionally mislead or does he not know that it happens? 

https://t.co/HW3zHY8zIP
